sponsor.partnerMessage: SoNA kicks off its biggest and boldest season yet on Oct. 29 at Walton Arts Center! In its 68th season, the 8-concert lineup features beloved classics, the annual Christmas show, a hybrid orchestra-jazz concert, groundbreaking contemporary voices, and more. CLICK HERE for tickets and info!

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • REVELxp has a position open for a General Manager of the University of Arkansas*
  • NWA Daily is hiring for an Ad Sales role. Please email us HERE if you or someone you know is interested!

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

posts.title: Weekend Round Up
posts.content:
Welcome to your weekend! Here are a few fun things you could add to your plans:

  • Itching for finds: Discover local crafts and fun antiques at the Flea in the Park event at Blowing Springs Park in Bella Vista today and Saturday from 9a-4p. 
  • Raise a glass: Don't miss the Oktoberfest themed First Friday this evening in Downtown Bentonville!
  • On fire: The 7th annual Frisco Inferno BBQ Competition takes place in Downtown Rogers Saturday at 301 S. 1st Street at the center of all the Downtown happenings related to Bikes Blues & BBQ. 
  • Don't be a square: The Razorback Greenway will be filled with fun as the Square 2 Square Bike Ride takes off tomorrow morning! 
  • Bluegrass: Springdale native and multiple CMA winner, Jenee Fleenor, is performing at the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks tonight at 7p. 
  • Choo-choo: Participants will be judged for their creative train creations and race through an obstacle course in the The Great Cardboard Train Race at the Rogers Historical Museum this Saturday at 10a. 
  • Vintage: Get your tickets for Vintage Market Days this Friday, Saturday, and Sunday at the Benton County Fairgrounds. 
  • For a ride: Enjoy the various musical performances, car and bike show events, and great food this weekend at the Bikes, Blues, & BBQ Motorcycle Rally in Rogers. 
  • Have a bier: Raise a glass and enjoy a Bavarian pretzel at the grand opening of Busshaus Biergarten tomorrow night. 
  • Swing batter swing: After Arkansas softball’s’ doubleheader on Sunday, fans can take an at-bat and anyone who hits a home run will receive FREE 2023 Razorback softball season tickets.

Wishing you a wonderful weekend, NWA! See you next week.

posts.title: Local Companies Recognized By Governor For International Success
posts.content:
Gov. Asa Hutchinson and the Arkansas District Export Council honored two NW Arkansas companies at an award ceremony this week for their excellence in global trade. 

  • Slim Chickens: Founded in Fayetteville, Slim Chickens received the Franchise Development Exporter Award. Slims has become one of the largest food service employers in the state, and has grown to include an international location in Kuwait, multiple locations throughout the U.K., and has plans to open more stores across Europe soon. 
  • White River Hardwoods: Family-owned White River Hardwoods manufactures embellished and traditional hardwood mouldings, corbels and architectural woodcarvings, and are currently working on a project for Disney Tokyo. The woodworking company received the Rising Star Exporter Award for their efforts in increasing export sales percentages while increasing overall revenue. 

Read the full TB&P article HERE.

posts.title: Share Life Changing Stories Today Through The Miracles & Magic Radiothon
posts.topic: Sponsored by Miracles and Magic Radiothon
posts.content:
While no-one ever wants to see their child in the hospital, the team at Arkansas Children’s NW have gone above and beyond to bring the best pediatric care available to NWA. If you’ve benefited from the excellent care at ACNW or know someone who owes their life to their amazing team, today is a great way to give back through the Miracles & Magic Radiothon. Tune in to Magic 107.9 and KNWA stations to hear stories, and call in to donate and share your ACNW story with a phone bank volunteer.

  • Share your miracle: Volunteers from the community are standing by the phone and want to hear your story! Call in and share your ACNW story by dialing 479-455-KIDS (5437).
  • Share the magic: The magic that makes the work of ACNW possible is the continued generosity of our amazing community. Call today or donate online to keep the magic going. 

Make a lifesaving difference and donate HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• At the center: The Howard on Central in Downtown Bentonville just opened and is leasing spaces at its incredible location! 
  • Batter up: The Razorbacks will host the Texas Rangers’ Instructional League team in a couple of scrimmages next Wednesday and Thursday at Baum-Walker Stadium. 
  • Out for a spin: E-scooter company, Spin, dropped off 100 of its S-300 model e-bikes in Fayetteville last week. 
  • So long: XNA will no longer offer the United direct flight from NW Arkansas to New Jersey. 
  • Occupied: The commercial vacancy rate in NWA dropped to 5.8%, according to the Skyline Report.
  • Join us: Would you like to share something in our newsletter? Check out our deals HERE. 

*Content is sponsored
